data.enText: the different parts which sth is made of; the way in which the different parts are organized
the chemical composition of the soil
the composition of the board of directors
a piece of music or art, or a poem
one of Beethoven's finest compositions
data.chText: 贝多芬最优美的音乐作品之一

data.enText: the act of composing sth
pieces performed in the order of their composition
data.chText: 按作曲顺序表演的作品

data.enText: the art of writing music
to study composition
a short text that is written as a school exercise; a short essay
the arrangement of people or objects in a painting or photograph

data.text: structure ♦ framework ♦ composition ♦ construction ♦ fabric ♦ make-up

data.enText: These are all words for the way the different parts of sth combine together or the way that sth has been made.
data.chText: 以上各词均指事物各个不同部分的组合、构造。

data.enText: structure
the way in which the parts of sth are connected together or arranged; a particular arrangement of parts
the structure of the building/human body
the social structure of society
the grammatical structures of a language
a salary structure
framework
a set of beliefs, ideas or rules that forms the basis of a system or society
data.chText: 指构成某个体系或社会基础的信仰、观点、准则：

data.enText: The report provides a framework for further research.
data.chText: 报告提供了进一步研究的原则。

data.enText: composition
( rather formal ) the different parts or people that combine to form sth; the way in which they combine
data.chText: 指不同部分或人的构成、组合方式：

data.enText: recent changes in the composition of the workforce
data.chText: 劳动力组合最近的变化

data.enText: construction
the way that sth has been built or made
ships of steel construction
fabric
( rather formal ) the basic structure of a society or an organization that enables it to function successfully
data.chText: 指社会、机构等的基本结构：

data.enText: This is a trend which threatens the very fabric of society .
data.chText: 这是威胁社会基本结构的趋势。

data.enText: make-up
the different people or things that combine to form sth; the way in which they combine
data.chText: 指不同人或事物的构成、构成方式：

data.enText: the genetic make-up of plants and animals
composition or make-up?

The main difference between these words is the level of formality. Composition is more often used in scientific and technical contexts; make-up is more often used in speech and journalism. Make-up also means the different qualities that combine to form sb's character.
data.chText: 上述两词的主要区别在于使用场合的正式程度。composition较常用于科技语境，make-up则较常用于口语和新闻报道中。make-up亦指人的性格、气质。

data.enText: the structure/framework/composition/construction/fabric/make-up of sth
the basic structure/framework/composition/construction/fabric of sth
the economic/political/social structure/framework/composition/fabric/make-up of sth
the chemical/genetic structure/composition/make-up of sth
a simple/complex structure/framework

simple_means.memory_skill: compos(e) 作曲 + -ite 属于 + -ion 行为, 状态

ex.enText: She wrote an essay on Homer.
ex.chText: 她写了一篇关于荷马的文章。

ex.enText: He's now revising the first draft of his essay.
ex.chText: 他目前正在修改他的文章初稿。

synonyms.bx: 指学生为某门课程所写的短文或论说文，或指关于政治、社会等的小品文、散文等。

ex.enText: Did you read the article on the information revolution?
ex.chText: 你读了有关信息革命的那篇文章没有？

ex.enText: This article discusses the events that led to her suicide.
ex.chText: 这篇文章讨论了导致她自杀的一系列事件。

synonyms.bx: 多指在报刊上发表的非小说类文章，如新闻报道、学术论文等。

ex.enText: He made several spelling mistakes in the composition.
ex.chText: 他在作文中犯了多处拼写错误。

synonyms.bx: 多指老师要求学生写的作文练习。

ex.enText: The professor wrote a paper on psychology.
ex.chText: 教授写了一篇心理学论文。

ex.enText: He delivered a paper on air pollution.
ex.chText: 他宣读了一篇关于空气污染的论文。

synonyms.bx: 多指在学术刊物上发表或在学术会议上宣读的专题论文，也指高等学校的学期论文等。

tr: the act of creating written works
example: writing was a form of therapy for him
it was a matter of disputed authorship

tr: something that is created by arranging several things to form a unified whole
example: he envied the composition of their faculty

tr: the way in which someone or something is composed
the spatial property resulting from the arrangement of parts in relation to each other and to the whole
example: harmonious composition is essential in a serious work of art

tr: an essay (especially one written as an assignment)
example: he got an A on his composition

tr: art and technique of printing with movable type
a musical work that has been created
example: the composition is written in four movements

example.ex: Television has transformed the size and social composition of the audience at great sporting occasions...
example.tran: 电视改变了重大体育赛事观众的规模和其社会阶层构成结构。

example.ex: Forests vary greatly in composition from one part of the country to another.
example.tran: 一个国家不同区域的森林在组成结构上存在很大的差异。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N <l>of</l> n

value.def: When you talk about the composition of something, you are referring to the way in which its various parts are put together and arranged.

example.ex: Mozart's compositions are undoubtedly amongst the world's greatest.
example.tran: 莫扎特的作品无疑位居世界上最伟大的作品之列。

value.def: The compositions of a composer, painter, or other artist are the works of art that they have produced.
A composition is a piece of written work that children write at school.

example.ex: He taught the piano, organ and composition...
example.tran: 他教授钢琴、管风琴和作曲。

example.ex: The course is designed to help students with colour and composition.
example.tran: 设置这门课程是为了指导学生如何运用色彩和构图。

value.def: Composition is the technique or skill involved in creating a work of art.

example.ex: These plays are arranged in their order of composition.
example.tran: 这些剧作是按照其创作的先后顺序安排的。

value.def: Composition is the act of composing something such as a piece of music or a poem.

trans: 相组成；物相组成；相结构成分
树种组成；物种组成；种类组成；种组成；群落种类组成
气体成分；气体的成分；气体组成
产品成分；产品构成；产品成份
元素组成；构成的化学元素
群体组成；小组的成员组合；小组成员组合；成要素；族组成
色彩构成；色彩构图；颜色合成；彩色合成
民族构成；种族构成；民族成分
植物区系组成；植物种类组成

partsOfSpeech.dec: op- 选择 + -in- + -ion 行为, 状态
con- 表强调 + centr 中心 + -ate 做, 造成 + -ion 行为, 状态
